note.p: Death: His house in Lancaster Gate, London (29 March 1894)
Education: St Paul's School; University of Heidelberg; Middle Temple (1841)

Career: Called to the Bar (1848); Justice of the Court of Queen's Bench (1868-1872); Sergeant-at-law (1868); Privy Councillor (1872); Judge of the Probate Court (1872-1875); President of the Probate Division, High Court of Justice (1875-1891); Lord of Appeal in ordinary (1891-1893); resigned
